The Gift that Keeps on Giving
Celebrate your graduation by giving back!
As you mark the completion of your academic journey at SIT, consider celebrating with a gift of $25 (or more!) to commemorate your graduation year and this special milestone.
Your gift will go directly towards the

, supporting your juniors who are facing financial challenges. The collective giving from Class of 2025's will send a strong message of encouragement, not just to your fellow SITizens, but also to SIT's donors and friends.
Join us in this journey of giving as we inspire future generations of SITizens to go further forward!
To make a gift, please complete the gift form below.
Alternatively, you can also make your gift through

Launched in 2022, Class Giving is an annual fundraising initiative that lasts throughout the academic year, for the year's graduating cohort to make a collective gift in support of their juniors through the SIT Bursary.

The SIT Bursary, valued at $3,000 each, is one of the most accessible financial aid instruments at SIT that is open to financially disadvantaged students (Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents) who come from households with a monthly per capita income of no more than $850.

Embark on your Giving journey right here at SIT as you graduate. Your gift will uplift and help make education more accessible to fellow SITizens, enabling your juniors to realise their fullest potential regardless of their financial situation.
What are some of the benefits of giving?
If you are a revenue contributor in Singapore, your gift (of $10 and more) made to SIT in calendar year 2022-2026 are eligible for a 250% tax deduction which can be utilised over 5 years.

A gift of $25 will commemorate your graduation year! Though a minimum amount of $10 is encouraged, please feel free to give any amount you are comfortable with. A 250% tax deduction will apply to gifts of $10 and more.
My gift is small – how will it help?

Your contribution, alongside gifts from your fellow Class of 2025 peers, will send a compelling message to your juniors and to SIT’s donors and friends, that SITizens are committed to supporting their own!
Singapore Institute of Technology. All Rights Reserved.

article_texts:
Class Giving 2025
Celebrate your graduation by giving back!
As you mark the completion of your academic journey at SIT, consider celebrating with a gift of $25 (or more!) to commemorate your graduation year and this special milestone.
Your gift will go directly towards the
SIT Bursary
, supporting your juniors who are facing financial challenges. The collective giving from Class of 2025's will send a strong message of encouragement, not just to your fellow SITizens, but also to SIT's donors and friends.
Join us in this journey of giving as we inspire future generations of SITizens to go further forward!
To make a gift, please complete the gift form below.
Alternatively, you can also make your gift through
Giving.sg

FAQ
chevron--up
What is Class Giving?
Launched in 2022, Class Giving is an annual fundraising initiative that lasts throughout the academic year, for the year's graduating cohort to make a collective gift in support of their juniors through the SIT Bursary.
chevron--up
What is the SIT Bursary?
The SIT Bursary, valued at $3,000 each, is one of the most accessible financial aid instruments at SIT that is open to financially disadvantaged students (Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents) who come from households with a monthly per capita income of no more than $850.
chevron--up
Why should I give?
Embark on your Giving journey right here at SIT as you graduate. Your gift will uplift and help make education more accessible to fellow SITizens, enabling your juniors to realise their fullest potential regardless of their financial situation.
chevron--up
What are some of the benefits of giving?
If you are a revenue contributor in Singapore, your gift (of $10 and more) made to SIT in calendar year 2022-2026 are eligible for a 250% tax deduction which can be utilised over 5 years.
chevron--up
How much should I give?
A gift of $25 will commemorate your graduation year! Though a minimum amount of $10 is encouraged, please feel free to give any amount you are comfortable with. A 250% tax deduction will apply to gifts of $10 and more.
chevron--up
My gift is small – how will it help?
Your contribution, alongside gifts from your fellow Class of 2025 peers, will send a compelling message to your juniors and to SIT’s donors and friends, that SITizens are committed to supporting their own!

.giving-form select option.disabled {
    background: #eeeeee;
    font-weight: bold;
}
.webform-submission-form { display: yes; }
.wrap.wrap--xl.wrap--center {
    padding: 0px !important;
}
$(document).ready(function()
{

$("form #edit-submit").click(function(event)
    {
        if($('#edit-yes-i-would-like-to-make-a-contribution-to-the-sit-bursary-as-pa input[name=yes_i_would_like_to_make_a_contribution_to_the_sit_bursary_as_pa]:checked').length <= 0)
        {
            $("#edit-yes-i-would-like-to-make-a-contribution-to-the-sit-bursary-as-pa span").css("color", "red");
        }
    });

    $("#edit-yes-i-would-like-to-make-a-contribution-to-the-sit-bursary-as-pa input[name=yes_i_would_like_to_make_a_contribution_to_the_sit_bursary_as_pa]").change(function(event)
    {
        $("#edit-yes-i-would-like-to-make-a-contribution-to-the-sit-bursary-as-pa span").css("color", "");
    });

$("select option[value^=NOVALUE]").attr('disabled','disabled').addClass("disabled");
    $("#giving-form").click(function(event)
    {
        $( ".giving-form" ).slideDown( "slow", function() {});
    });
});
